div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE PETITION OF KUNIJIRO TOGUCHI FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
To the Honorable the Judges of the above entitled court:

The petition of Kunijiro Toguchi respectfully represents, that he is a subject of the Empire of Japan; that he is be- ing detained in the United States Immigration Station in the City of Seattle in this District by Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, unlawfully and without justiciable cause in this; that your petitioner has a pass- port from the Government of Japan entitling him to enter the United States; that he is not a laborer or afflicted with a loathsome disease, nor in any wise disqualified under the laws of the United States for entry into the United States, but that wrongfully and opressively the said Henry M. White and the Secretary of Labor of the United States upon appeal, have adjudged the petitioner to be a contract laborer and to be seeking entry into the united States in violation of the Act of Congress in reference to contract laborers; that it appears in and by the record of this petitioner's examination in the Immigration office, that he is a clerk and not a laborer, and that in order that the cause of this petitioner's detention mat be fully inquired into and adjudged, it is necessary that the record made by the Immigration office at Seattle be re- turned into this court, together with the testimony taken upon the examination of this petitioner.
WHEREFORE, your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may issue directed to the said Henry M. White, Commiss-

inoer of Immigration of the United States at Seattle, command- ing him that he do produce the body of your petitioner before this court, together with the record of the examination of your petitioner, and the testimony then taken, and that upon the hearing of such writ it be adjudged that your petitioner be discharged.
k toguchi Petitioner.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. }} SS.

KUNIJIRO TOGUCHI, being duly sworn according to law says: That he is the petitioner above named; that he has heard the foregoing petition read, explained and translated, and that the facts therein stated are true.
k toguchi
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th day of December, A. D. 1916.
James Kiefer Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON Northern Division.
IN THE MATTER OF THE PETITION OF KUNIJIRO TOGUCHI FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION DEC 11 1916 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Edm Lakin Deputy
JAMES KIEFER for Petitioner.
SUITE 327 COLMAN BLDG. SEATTLE
